body.p: The Ohio State Militia consisted of two principle branches, active and enrolled. The 1857 Militia Law of Ohio created twenty-three divisions of universally enrolled militia consisting of all white men between the ages of eighteen and forty-five who were subject to duty as called by the governor. Active militia consisted of volunteer companies.
